CreditLine: Acquired by Henry Walters with the Massarenti Collection, 1902
Description: For more information on this triptych, please see Zeri catalogue number 35, pp. 58-60.
Dimensions: H with original carved and gilded frame: 26 3/8 x W: 21 7/16 x D: 1/2 in. (67 x 54.5 x 1.3 cm); Center panel painted surface H including framing: 26 3/8 x W: 10 13/16 in. (67 x 27.5 cm); Left wing painted surface H including framing: 26 x W: 5 5/16 in. (66 x 13.5 cm); Right wing painted surface H including framing: 25 9/16 x W: 5 5/16 in. (64.9 x 13.5 cm)

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: The International Style: The Arts in Europe Around 1400
Exhibitions.Textblock: The International Style: The Arts in Europe Around 1400. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1962.

Inscriptions: [Transcription] On the scroll held by John the Baptist: ECC / E AG / NVS / DEI / ECC / E Q / VI / TOLL / IS PE / CCA / TA; [Inscription] Fragmentary remains of the names of the saints in red on either side of each figure- now visible only near Saints James and Margaret; [Inscription] Above the Virgin are vestiges of Gabriel's salutation
Provenance: Don Marcello Massarenti Collection, Rome [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [1881 catalogue: no. 184, as Umbrian School, 14th-15th century; 1897 catalogue: no. 58, as Tuscan School, mid 14th century]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1902, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Madonna of Humility with Saints
